comments:
1.  In debug perspective, start a debug session that opens the Memory View by 
context.
2.  Window->New Window
3.  The new window will also have the Memory View opened.
4.  Terminate the debug session.
5.  Go back to the first window and select something from the Debug View.

It will result in the following exception.  The Memory View is handling 
selection events from the Debug View after it is disposed.  The selection 
listener in the Memory View is leaked because it adds/removes selection 
listener from the selection service of the active workbench window.  In the 
case when there are multiple windows, one of the listeners get left behind.  
Memory View should make use if its view site to get to the selection service.
